Reviews.Title: “Birthday was made extra special”
Reviews.Author: harry2310
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 my partner's birthday and I must have mentioned it upon booking as when we arrived he was given a little birthday pack consisiting of a card, nuts, beer, sweets etc. Just a nice little touch-got us off on the right foot straight away. Beds were comfy, no noise in foyers or from other rooms could be heard, everything in room worked (fridge, alarm clock, etc etc) Only thing I'll fault the room on was there was a red wine stain on the floor. Service from reception/concierge was excellent-we were really impressed with their local knowledge and advice. The location was perfect for us as we went to a Mariners game and wandered around the streets shopping. We used the pool but didnt eat at the restaurant. Late check out was ideal! We went there on a family and friends price and the value for money on this was FANTASTIC!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels downtown”
Reviews.Author: Vision2728
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business trip. Very nice hotel in all areas accept for a limited food menu. Otherwise everything was very good. I got a great rate through hotels.ca too.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, lobby and facilities, but rooms need some help.”
Reviews.Author: Tom25
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at this hotel on three occasions, as the location across from Lake Union is Fantastic. And it is within walking distance of Seattle Center and the steet car line to downtown. And I like the public areas and the staff. But what I didn't like the past trip to the hotel was the first room we got assigned didn't have a working phone. The 2nd room didn't have a working toilet, and finally, the 3rd room worked.. But there is NO excuse for rooms being assigned that weren't in top flight condition. And for that reason, I give it a POOR rating overall. And worse than that, I am not likely to return. Which is unfortunate, as in the past I would of given the property an "Very Good" or "Excellent" rating. But not this time around. And parking costs $20 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of Lake Union”
Reviews.Author: Travelingilly
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard by Marriott is right across the street from Lake Union with great views of the lake and beyond. Watch the seaplanes land and take off from the lake constantly. Lots of great restaurants nearby and it's a short walk to Space Needle. Had a great stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: tonypct
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at this hotel and it was a Saturday night. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The location was OK. Not much around; you really would need a car to get around. The front desk folks were very friendly and greeted me warmly when I checked in. The view out of my window was fine. I had a nice view of the Space Needle and of course, all the construction going on all around Seattle. But that was no fault of the hotel. There is an onsite restaurant, which I did not use. My only complaint is the parking situation. It is $20 per night to park and the garage is underground and not so easy to access. TV was a large screen high definition with HD channels. That was a definite plus as I've stayed in many a hotel with HD TVs that offer no HD channels. Overall, a decent, clean place to stay. Don't expect luxury but do expect a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Smells Terrible like a smokey bar room”
Reviews.Author: country_livin
Reviews.Content: When I checked in to this hotel, the smell of smoke was so overwhelming, I should have turned around and gone home. I had pre paid, unfortuneately. I love marriotts, normally, and this was equal to a motel 6, except for the cost! No coffee offered in the lobby on a Sunday morning, no extra's at all. The view out of our window was apartments, the shabby low rent type. I was extremely disappointed as you can surely tell! Oh, did I mention that I am a smoker and even though, the stink was nauseating. BTW this was a Marriotts Courtyard Hotel, but there was NO courtyard. The residence inn across the lake looks like a courtyard but is actually a Residence Inn. My Bad for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on South Lake Union”
Reviews.Author: EMK55
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel right on South Lake Union. There is a lot of stuff to do close by. The hotel is very nice. The hot tub and pool area are also very nice. The room was nice and the free wifi was greatly appreciated. I could hear the people in the room next to me in the morning. The bed was very comfortable and having a selection of pillows was nice. I did not have a view from my room but once you step out the front doors it is very scenic. The hotel staff was very nice and accomodating as well.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: margilib
Reviews.Content: The view from my room was gorgeous! The staff were so helpful and courteous! The location was easy to everything you would want or need! The parking was awkward but available.

Reviews.Title: “Just "OK"”
Reviews.Author: Emma S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 days, when we first arrived the man at the front desk was very rude. We had been looking forward to this trip for months and had researched the hotel prior to our stay. When my fiancé asked the man about the free breakfast buffet we had read about online he informed us that if we wanted the buffet we would have to pay $13.00 a day per person to get it. So the next morning we ended up skipping breakfast. My fiancé asked a different front desk attendant about the breakfast buffet they let him know that it was free and didn't understand why the other man had told us we would be charged. The location is ok, it costs about $8 for a taxi downtown. We were switched rooms, and neither of our rooms had a refrigerator which was hard since we were staying there for a full week and couldn't keep any leftovers. Overall, I'm surprised this hotel is a Marriott. All other Marriott's I have been to have been a lot nicer! Its an ok place to stay, and the view of the lake is nice if you are on one of the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and they take pets!”
Reviews.Author: arlin9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas and everything was perfect. The hotel was in a grear location, the staff was friendly and the cost of bringing our german shepard was only 10$ a night!

Reviews.Title: “hotel”
Reviews.Author: kalagapp
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel by the waterfront. The restaurants were modest, the staff are very nce and the rooms are clean. I attended a meeting here, the classrooms/auditoriums were not as up to date. It is near Pikes market and the restaurants there

Reviews.Title: “great location, functional”
Reviews.Author: Philip B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is comfortable, clean and well located. nothing about this place is pretentious. Our experience (corner room floor 12) was good. a little street noise but not disturbing and only noise from neighboring rooms was of doors closing. Very well placed for trams and Amtrak and downtown. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good option in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Yaron_Naveh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in March 2011. The staff are very nice and friendly. The rooms are just standard but if you ask for a lake view that's a nice upgrade. The hotel is in a walking distance to the needle, but I took a taxi for other attractions. If the weather is good I assume you can also walk to some of them. This hotel is a good option for business or travel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice, friendly little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anndi07
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a "Courtyard" branded hotel by Marriott. They're smaller, cheaper, and yet still cozy. The staff were friendly and helpful. The lobby is large and inviting. We had a lake-view room on the third floor with a king bed and sofabed. There was also a large TV and a desk. The room felt a little cramped, but the bed was comfortable, and everything was clean. The only downside, which was really quite disappointing, was that the hotel was quite cold, but when we turned up the heat and the external heater in the corner by the window got started, it smelled like it was going to burn the place down. Not pleasant. So we turned it off and buried under the covers instead. Other than that, we enjoyed our short stay here. It's within walking distance of the Space Needle, which is an obvious must-see in Seattle. Also, our room was located to the side of the hotel (to the right, when looking at the lake) and it was at an angle where we could see into other people's rooms, and they could see into ours. For this reason, we kept the curtains closed for privacy. Staring into other rooms isn't my favourite... We had to depart from the hotel at 4am the following morning to catch a flight, so we spoke to the front desk staff the night before, asking about cab fare to the airport. We were told that the flat rate is $40-45 to the airport, and that they could have a towncar waiting for us at 4am to drive us there for $40. A towncar was also spontaneously summoned to drive us to the Space Needle (really no point in driving there) for a mere $7. It seemed towncars were more common than cabs, and we were told by the bus driver who brought us into Seattle that they would cost the same. We also took one from the Greyhound bus station to the hotel, for another mere $7. We didn't take any cabs. And as promised, we received a call to our room at 4am the next morning informing us that our towncar was waiting. It ended up being a large, black, luxury SUV. For $40. I'm very grateful that the hotel staff were so willing and helpful when it came to transportation, as this was our first time in Seattle. It was also, however, the highlight of our stay. Not to say that there is anything wrong with this hotel, just that it's an average hotel with very nice staff. We were happy with our choice of staying here, as the price was great in comparison to other Marriott-brand hotels in the area (as we are Marriott Reward members) and we did get a nice view of the lake and watch a seaplane land. Oh, and there is also free WiFi here, but don't drink the bottled water - that'll cost ya!

Reviews.Title: “Great location comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: OldWailukuInn
Reviews.Content: Loved the location just below Pike's Place. Great for walking to all the sites in Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Nice if you can stand the construction noise”
Reviews.Author: AZtravels_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a standard Courtyard, nothing fancy. I had a great view, but the construction going on outside on the street keep me awake all night. The work is continuous and doesn't stop. The staff were very nice and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great View & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ssb44
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly staff, clean rooms, parking is a little high, but you are close to downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Superior service, other reviewers correct about the beds.”
Reviews.Author: DougUtah
Reviews.Content: Service level here amazed me. This staff could immediately interchange with the Ritz Carlton and no one would be the wiser. I almost want to tour their HR. This is a walking business location for me with free street parking at night. Marriott Waterfront though is my prime choice for personal sans vehicle stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrscorrad
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on location (near family) and price. Was good on both. While the room certainly was not luxurious, it was a nice size and decent, though a bit noisy at times. The bed was surprisingly comfortable. Towels were really scratchy. Our view was horrible (2nd floor) and we basically looked out onto a concrete roof. Staff were friendly and helpful. Had the buffet breakfast one morning ($13.95) which was pretty good. $20 to park. Hard to get in and out of the parking lot because of construction in front of the hotel while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “the south side of lake union is fun and beautiful ...”
Reviews.Author: hankbauer
Reviews.Content: ... that's where this hotel is. we have stayed here many times. service is consistently good, the rooms do not cause claustrophobia, and we love being near the lake. free wifi and access to the hotel's computer come in handy. it's an easy walk to seattle's wooden boat museum where old boats are lovingly restored, as well as to at least half a dozen restaurants on the water with views of the lake, boaters, kayakers, float planes.

Reviews.Title: “In Desperate Need of Upgrades, or Possibly a Wrecking Ball”
Reviews.Author: mollydotcom
Reviews.Content: This is one of those reviews that's difficult to write, because the staff at this hotel were very welcoming and helpful. But this hotel is in desperate need of upgrades - at the very least. There are changes in the area with Amazon expanding its campus right up to the lake and the recently constructed apartment houses behind putting this hotel in harm's way. I honestly don't know if the structure can survive as a hotel, but time will tell. Whether it's this consideration or not, the decor here is extremely depressing - dark carpeting, dark and aging furniture, very uncomfortable mattresses. The room was clean, the wifi free and good, and again, the service was notable. But this is Seattle, dark and grey most of the time as it is. The property needs to be decorated with color and light. It's also mere steps away from a corner of Lake Union, with some of the rooms overlooking the Lake - this gives an opportunity to bring a brighter theme to the hotel, updating and freshening the accommodations as well as providing a generally more uplifting environment. We had meetings on-site, and while the meeting room was spacious, it also was difficult to keep cool and hear people speaking as the air conditioning is noisy. The service was also a little off timing, morning coffee service showed up about 10 minutes before the morning break service, which showed up around 10 minutes before lunch! Otherwise, the room was well equipped technically, we had ample power for 30+ technogeeks, projection screen, whiteboard and solid wifi. Good luck to this property, the people were great, the location unstable, the property in need of desperate upgrades but the pressures do seem largely external and if it is as I suspect, the decision to not upgrade the property until the area stabilizes or doesn't, it isn't wise business to spend a lot of money for the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: red0099
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice location near downtown, just across the street from Lake Union. There are several choices of places to eat within walking distance. The staff of this hotel is outstanding. Very helpful and friendly. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: bellakitsy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wedding in Seattle and stayed at the Courtyard Marriott/Lake Union. We were lucky to be there during the Bite of Seattle and we were able to walk there from the hotel. The staff was very helpful and polite, room was nice and clean and they had a great breakfast buffet, not included in the price of the room. We plan on staying there again on our next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: monatravel
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this Courtyard and were very disappointed with the accomodations. It is definitely not up to the standards of the many other Courtyards where we have stayed. The hotel is in need of updates to the rooms. The bed was very uncomfortable. We had to have them change our room. There is major construction on the road where the hotel is situated. The staff was helpful but it didn't outweigh the quality of the accomodations.The name of the hotel implies it is in the downtown area, It is not! I would skip this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Motel 8”
Reviews.Author: beckyjo77
Reviews.Content: We pulled in to Seattle and were tired after a long days journey...unfortunately we pulled into the Marriot...really just an overpriced super 8 with a view. They charged us 150.00 for the night - at that price you would think the parking would be free ( its not 20.00 per day) they would at least give you a roll and some juice for breakfast ( nope again) or have a microwave to in the noisy room ( at least spring for some sound-proof windows a this price). The hotel itself is beautiful ( although our bathroom smelled like urine EWWW) and the view was great, but for 150.00 ( actually more after taxes 175.00 I believe) I would have liked a quiets nites sleep.. We won't stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way...”
Reviews.Author: S_Bettac
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by the agent who took our reservations. She thought of everything and updated all my information right there on the line. She could not have been more pleasant or informative and I left the call very excited about our destination. When we arrived, we were greeted by the most personable host shocking me by allowing us to check into our room at 10:30 AM in the morning. She offered excellent recommendations for restaurants, attractions and parking. Her advice on parking saved us $40. The room was pleasantly spacious with a sofa, desk, king size bed and in-room coffee maker. The LG flat screen television was one of the nicest we have seen in a hotel room. There’s free internet access and coffee in the lobby which has a beautiful fireplace and comfortable seating. Both the indoor pool and spa were very fabulous. I know you may be thinking so what – this is standard in a lot of places – but this place does it all and well. Oh, I forgot to mention, they also have an onsite Market for those forgotten or last minute items. We were so impressed we booked another stay before we left. Next door is Buca di Beppo, a family style restaurant. I highly recommend visiting at least once during your stay. If you sign up for email club prior to your visit you may receive a coupon for Free Ziti and/or dessert. Family style means family style and the servings are huge. When they say it will serve three – it defiantly will serve at least three and probably more. If you make it down to Pike Market you must visit the Pike Brewing Company. Stop by the information desk at the entrance of Pike Market to get a discount coupon for your drink.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel with a Great View of the Lake”
Reviews.Author: tyadams7
Reviews.Content: I was there on business. Helpful staff who knew the surrounding area well. I am never a fan of having to pay for parking at a hotel, let alone $20, but at least it was a covered garage. Comfortable rooms with quick internet and really nice scenic views. Really cratchy towels in the bathroom. There also was no free continental breakfast. While I did not have the $15 breakfast, my colleague did and said it was nowhere near worth the money he paid. Overall, a very good-caliber hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ramblinman84
Reviews.Content: Staff was great. Rooms were OK--not the cleanest, but OK--They did not seem like the usual Courtyard rooms. Great location

Reviews.Title: “Adequate and pleasant for a business stay”
Reviews.Author: curmudgeon99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several nights recently on a business trip. Very convenient walking distance to the Amazon offices on N Terry. Location overlooking Lake Union is nice, though half the rooms will be overlooking un-scenic parking lots in the back. I thought it was a little pricey for what you got, but I would stay there again if it fit the circumstance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and great beds!”
Reviews.Author: travelingagainWa
Reviews.Content: We are from the Seattle area and need to stay in Downtown. This is a beautiful place for the hotel as the view of Lake Union is great and they have several good restaurants within walking distance. Price was good but inside parking was $20.00 but there was less expensive parking across the street. We will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: KSTBH37
Reviews.Content: Our room was comfortable, but it was arranged in a weird angle. The bed was next to the TV instead of in front of it, which made it difficult to view the television, and we had a terrible view of the one of the other wings of the hotel's rooftop. The staff was very nice and we enjoyed a delicous (but expensive) breakfast in the morning. The one great thing about this hotel is that they have parking so we didn't have to worry about street parking or finding our way around in the car we did everything on foot.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises here”
Reviews.Author: Entlebuch
Reviews.Content: Pretty much what you expect from a Courtyard by Marriott. Good service, clean comfortable room, above average price. This particular hotel has a very good location for restaurants and it is easy to catch the trolley to the downtown area. We spoke to others that stayed in the hotel and the rooms at the front have a good view of Lake Union but traffic noise is a problem. We had a view of a usually empty parking lot next to the hotel but our room was quiet and really how much time do you usually spend looking out the windows of hotel rooms. The room rates are high and the parking fee is very high in my opinion but there is no free parking in Seattle. I did like the free wireless, which had decent speed. The computer in the business center is an antique and should be recycled. By the way, plentiful parking is cheaper in the lot right behind the hotel and the area seems safe enough

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine hotel, but please sort out your Internet!”
Reviews.Author: Accentmonkey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, the bed is comfortable, the location is excellent (yes, I have one of the parking-lot-view rooms, but you can also see the Space Needle from here, which I like), the staff are friendly. That's all good. We have also been provided with a fridge in our room, which is nice. But I agree with the person who complained about being nickel-and-dimed. Shouldn't we at least get a free bottle of water when we arrive? Also, for a business hotel, the Internet connection is absolutely terrible. Colleagues of mine have complained about this before (I work for a large company with offices nearby), but nothing has been done about it. So don't expect to get much work done in your room while you're here.

Reviews.Title: “Significant problem with Charges/look at your bank statements carefully”
Reviews.Author: michelemd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night and used my Marriott rewards. But after checking out they continued to charge me and place multiple holds on my credit card. They over charged me by 132.85 broken into 4 smaller charges over several days. I called the hotel and spoke to Rachel in accounting. She admitted it was their error and that the charges would be released within three days. Well more than a week later I had to call again. Now Rachel has me speak with her supervisor, who tries to explain that with each shift they recharge your card "it's a system thing"...then. when I ask her why the charges were still taking place two days after I checked out...she tries to blame everything on my bank. I contacted my bank who explained that Marriott placed the charges and refused to release them...so by law now becuase the hotel wouldn't release them after I checked out that the bank has to wait 8 days from the day the hotel places them to credit my money back. If Marriott had released the charges they would have been credited back. So it was 100% the hotel's doing. I have never ever expereinced this kind of treatment from any hotel. To top it off Rachel's supervisor told me the only authority within Marriott higher than her was Mr. Marriott!!!!! She should be terminated immediately. DO NOT STAY AT THIS MARRIOTT!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Graet location perfect place”
Reviews.Author: HuddersfieldDot
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel as a pre and post cruise stop. It was a great suprise so well run, spotless comfortable rooms with wiifi, laundry and pool. We loved it

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Parties FYI.”
Reviews.Author: streffers
Reviews.Content: The main thing this hotel has going for it is its location and the views (should you be lucky enough to get a room with view of Lake Union). We recently used this hotel to accommodate guests for our wedding at the adjacent Virginia V (which was incredible). While they didn't drop the ball entirely, they definitely left some things to be desired. First off, coordinating our wedding block proved to be more difficult than we would have imagined, though for this we blame Marriott more than this specific location. The planners for wedding blocks seem to be located at corporate headquarters and as a result it was often difficult to get consistent information regarding our local block. When we tried to get info from this location we were always told that they couldn't do anything and we needed to contact the above mentioned planners. We arranged for our guests to receive gift bags we had put together as they checked into the hotel. However, as we spoke to our guests we came to find out that a number of them had not received their bags upon arrival. The first room they put us in (again the bride and groom, which they were aware of) had views of the building's ventilation systems and stains on the walls. While they were quick to give us another room, it was kind of disheartening to be given that room in the first place. In addition, a large number of our guests were placed in rooms with equally bad views, which isn't so bad except for the fact that they sell you on the views when you're checking the place out as a possible venue. Finally, on our last night we were hanging out with some friends in our room (about 5 total) around 3AM. We were keeping it fairly quiet, but management came up and knocked on the door. Fair enough, it wasn't early and I can appreciate the situation. However, instead of asking us to keep it down we were told, "If we have to come up here again we will kick you all out of the hotel." It was not the warning but the manner in which it was given that we found offensive. While we understand the issue of noise complaints, we did bring them thousands of dollars of business and a little tact might have been appreciated. Threats don't typically make you feel like a valued customer. Anyway, the purpose of this review was to relay our experience to anyone who might be thinking of using this hotel to accommodate a large number of guests. While the location and views are nice, this hotel is very disorganized and we found it added quite a bit of stress to any already complex situation.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Bmorechick
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a stay at this hotel (3/26-3/28) and had a very pleasant stay. We were in town specifically for a cervical cancer retreat but we also planned on sightseeing as well. There is no shuttle to/from the airport so be prepared to pay approximately $45 for a cab ride. They do not have flat fares so traffic and the speed of the driver will affect this price. We did not have a car so we did not have to worry about the parking fee. Our room faced Lake Union and the view was FABULOUS! I did not experience any room noise as others noted except when I opened the window and of course that is expected. Watching the sunrise and people rowing on the lake, the boats sailing and the seaplanes taking off/landing was fantastic. The location is close to the space needle ($5 cab ride) and there are plenty of restaurants in walking distance. Jillians (sports bar) is across the street and Outback Steakhouse is in the next block. There are three great restaurants to the left of the hotel that have early and late happy hour. We went to all three! The bar/lounge is really nice and the bartenders are really friendly. The front desk staff was GREAT. They were very accomodating with suggestions, letting us borrow items (tape, scissors) from the front desk, and helping us with meeting room set up. There is no 24 hour room service so that was disappointing. We did eat the breakfast buffet one morning and that was $13.95. Overall, I had a great stay. If I visited Seattle again, I would probably stay at the Marriott Residence Inn only because they had balconies, but they lacked many amenities that the Courtyard had so it would be a toss up!

Reviews.Title: “Beds and linen are fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: krisdeane
Reviews.Content: I find interesting that the hotel was not full by any means and as a member in their preferred club, I did not rate a room with a view of the lake. The towels were dismal at best and I shared that with the staff at checkout and received an "I'm sorry" but the delivery was certainly not heartfelt. Total cost for one night is near 200 dollars. Room was 139, plus tax, parking 20, plus tax and that gets you right up to 200 bucks. I would likely not stay there again. Not enough value for my cash!

Reviews.Title: “Average...maybe above.”
Reviews.Author: kimkeysreno
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in nicer Courtyards but this was in a great location. It had a nice bar and sitting area with gas logs. We were right across from the Lake. The room was ok, wasn't there much. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a great time on our trip. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: secora
Reviews.Content: Great location to access Downtown Seattle, Space Needle, Lake Union. Easy to get to and easy to get back to airport. They were nice to upgrade my room to a top-floor waterfront view, however, no other service people went above and beyond, but at least I didn't have anything to complain about. Simple hotel, very quiet, $20 garage parking. I left my car and walked all over, it was great! Clean and spacious room with comfortable bed. Everything downtown is pricey, so I'd say I was willing to pay for good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jaydub22
Reviews.Content: Great location for price. We were near the Seattle Center and could walk around without trouble. While it isn't the "top end" Marriott, it served it's purpose just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Content: It was awesome! you could see the sea planes landing across the street. Parking was a little steep at $18 but you did'nt need to drive.Take the streetcar downtown. Rooms were nice but to save midnight parties from aparment buildings across the ally way get rooms with a lake view or ending in even digits. The 4th floor was a little nosiy but higher floors are quieter.One suggestion is to make bigger parking stall because a wide car coming in at 9,10 pm can't really get in unless denting bumpers or spending 30 minutes getting into the concreate covered stall. Other than that it was awesome if you don't have an expensive wide euopean car like I did at 9,10 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Glad To Leave This One”
Reviews.Author: OZITravellers
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel over the telephone, understanding that the relatively high room rate included a continental breakfast. As they do not offer 2 x Queen size beds, we had to take a King size with our daughter sleeping on a pull-out (day/night lounge). Making up the pull-out was no great problem, but the hotel did not supply blankets or a quilt for this bed: considering they knew we would be using the pull-out, the lack of sufficient bedding was disappointing, but not a show-stopper. After two phone calls, Housekeeping finally delivered a quilt. Unfortunately, by the time the pull-out was extended, there wasn't much floor space left in what had initially appeared to be a comfortable room. When we checked at Reception about the continental breakfast we were informed there wasn't one but we could purchase a buffet breakfast (forget the cost, but it certainly wasn't cheap). Referring the matter to the Duty Manager was a waste of time: he was disinterested and unhelpful. Considering the tariff, this all put a rather unpleasant taste in our mouths, so we found alternative accommodation. We checked out the next morning and moved to the The Holiday Inn 3-4 blocks closer to downtown, considerably cheaper and much friendlier and more helpful staff. This was the first time we had used a Marriott Hotel - it will probably also be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Small but adequate”
Reviews.Author: happpycamper
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great for a single or couple traveling. It was too small for me and my two teenagers. We like the location because of the proximty to the new lightrail. Our last visit we stayed in the Marriott Residence Inn, just down the street and it seems like a much better value. Much bigger rooms, usually suites with full kitchen and seperate bedrooms. They also provide a very decent complimentary breakfast. So a great place for families. That said, the courtyard was fine, clean, bed was quite comfortable, hotel looks fresh and clean, the staff were all friendly and helpful. Others have complained about the walk to Seattle Center. It does go along a very busy road, but the sidewalk is plenty wide and it's a short distance. We didn't have any problems or complaints about that. Joeys is a great place to eat and we really enjoyed the Experience music project. There's not a lot for young children, but my teenagers really enjoyed it. Take coins for the lightrail (bills are problematic in their machine) , it's $1.75 for adults for 2hrs., .50 for kids 17 and under.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in downtown!!!”
Reviews.Author: road_warrior_4_ever
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! Good value. I'm on the road most of the time for business and this hotel has everything you need. Seriously! Great staff, clean hotel, comp. internet, full bar/lounge and restaurant. They even offer room service for breakfast and dinner! The lobby is very comfortable. I enjoyed the large fitness center and pool area. Another nice thing about this hotel is that there are at least 10 excellent restaurants that are in walking distance. As of December 2007, the Lake Union Street Car station is one block from the hotel. It's sweet! You can take the street car right into the heart of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again....”
Reviews.Author: threenights
Reviews.Content: Sad…. I expected the “Marriot” accommodations and service to match an average rating. …. I was terribly disappointed in both the staff and the room. The small room offered window view of an apartment / condo complex and a building with boarded up windows; the room had dirty windows, the bathroom fan was not working and the room had very poor lighting. The staff service; slow to respond and/or non responsive; seemed to me they are disorganized. We will not stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: turkscaicos
Reviews.Content: This was not a quality Marriott property. The beds were very uncomfortable. You could hear hotel noise in the rooms (ie: toilets flushing, showers running, doors opening/slamming). The windows were very thin, so you heard road traffic, which was quite significant on a Friday morning at 7 am. We paid $229 plus taxes for this room. When you add tax and $17 for parking, it was not a good value. The rooms were clean, but dated. At check-in we were told we could walk to the Space Needle. That was very poor advice to give to a family (or anyone). The only direct route goes through a tunnel. Every other route we tried, we were unable to cross divided Highway 99. I would never suggest anyone walk from this hotel to the space needle. The downtown bus is at the front door providing great access to downtown, except it is not a Free Shuttle, which other hotels in the area apparently have. This was not a Marriott experience that I am used to.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectaions”
Reviews.Author: cushclan
Reviews.Content: The place was great. It is a chain hotel, but it was nicely decorated, the food was very satisfactory, the bar was friendly, the pool and hot tub area wereclean and nice, the room was spacious the bath very nice, even had the concave shower curtain rod -- and the view is pretty durned good. I expected just a no frills room, and it wasn't the Ritz, but it was very nice and it did exceed my expectaions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: eolian
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on a leisure trip to the Seattle. The rooms were clean and nicely furnished. The internet worked well in the room. The pool was warm and our daughter had lots of fun swimming in it. The hotel is in walking distance to several restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Billing problems”
Reviews.Author: Feefle
Reviews.Content: I'll say first that the accommodations were okay. The room was quite small (especially considering the price), but I had no issues with cleanliness. I also appreciated that they offered Wi-Fi access in the lobby and made a few computers with attached printers available to guests. My negative opinion is due mostly to billing problems that I want to warn others about. I won't go into too many boring details, but business travelers in particular should take care. The front desk staff acknowledged when I arrived and at check-out that the company I was associated with would be charged (even though they had me swipe my credit card at check-in). Cut to a few weeks later and my bank statement showed that they charged the room to me (several days after I left). When I called to complain, they were unapologetic. I have to admit that I'm still mad about it, but I can honestly say that if you go to Seattle, you can do better. I spent the rest of my time in Seattle at the Mediterranean Inn where the accommodations were just as nice but much less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Sterile, Poor Value for the Location”
Reviews.Author: Kris_K_D
Reviews.Content: Coutyard Marriott Downtown Seattle/Lake Union is standard hotel chain fare -- sterile atmosphere; expensive, bland food; and lackluster service. The location is not ideal -- situated on the outskirts of downtown in a high-traffic area -- and their shuttle service isn't all too user-friendly (book in advance, only a handful of pre-determined stops, no "regular" schedule). Parking is expensive ($15/night) and a tight squeeze (6' clearance) in the garage. The room was clean and average, but could use some updating, and the amenities were ho-hum. The furniture was uncomfortable -- the mattress too firm and the couch stiff and boxy. The breakfast buffet was expensive ($30 for two!) and the spread was what you could find for free at other hotels and hotel chains -- fruit, cereal, oatmeal, rubbery scrambled eggs, pastries, and make-your-own waffles. For the rate charged, there are far better hotels -- with more character and more personal service -- in more convenient locations. For a place with unique character go to the Hotel Max. For a great location with quiet Northwest comfort go to the Inn at the Market.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place To Stay In Seattle”
Reviews.Author: JTraveler82
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful stay at the Courtyard Marriott on Lake Union. We were in town for a wedding, and about 75 guests stayed at this hotel. The rooms are very spacious, clean, and have all of the necessary ammenities. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. The pool and restaurant are very nice (great breakfast buffet) and the entire building is well maintained. Many of our rooms had an incredible view of Lake Union. The hotel is in a good location and in walking distance from Seattle Center, Downtown, and Pike Place Market. There is also a convenient shuttle that takes you to different destinations in the city. There are many great restaurants around the lake surrounding the hotel. We had such a comfortable and enjoyable stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: calskier
Reviews.Content: I read several good reviews and was not disappointed. Effortless check-in, friendly and attentive staff, free parking across the street (if space available and only evening until 7 a.m. - good incentive for me to get up early and get to my meeting on time). There is very good freeway access, as I had to go to meetings in Bellevue the 2 days there. The main reason I stayed here was price; although I was there on business I work for government and we can't pay high rates (Bellevue rates are very high during the week), even if this means slogging through traffic to get to a meeting next door to the hotel where everyone else is staying. At government rate this was good value; even at a regular or especially discount rate I'm sure this is still a good deal. Also: free broadband (wired) in room; free WiFi in lobby I was told but didn't test; nice snack and sundry store in lobby, great views of lake, excellent fitness room (for a hotel), pool & sauna I would have liked to have tried had I brought trunks, and very conveniently located close to downtown Seattle. One night I walked to and from Icon Grill (worth a visit, although pricy). During rush hour it's a little slow to walk as there are a lot of feeder and access roads in between. There's even a drive through coffee shop down the street on the way to the Interstate (just past actually, which is why I didn't try it).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Williamsons
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 4-7, 2006. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and we had the room type we reserved waiting for us when we arrived. The pool and spa were nice - great that they are indoors. The shuttle bus personnel were prompt and informative. All staff was extremely courteous. We would stay there again and would recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “great stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: Bamboo2010
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Great location, great staff at front desk, housekeeping, and restaurant! My daughter had a great time in the pool, which was very clean. Since we stayed there over the weekend, there was ample free parking across the street. If you have a lake view, you get to watch the airplanes take off from the lake!

Reviews.Title: “More than meets the eye, unfortunately.”
Reviews.Author: Californian2
Reviews.Content: Great views, bright and modern decor, friendly staff, but our non-smoking room had a terrible odor, and the windows do not open, so there is no way to get fresh air in! Be advised if you have a keen sense of smell. We just checked out this morning after a bad night's sleep. Oh, and speaking of that, the sheets can't be more than a scratchy 100 thread count.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Lake Union for one night on April 14th. Nice hotel. It looks like the hotel was recently renovated. The furniture was new and the rooms are very clean. Parking is priced at a premium at $15/night, but there is free parking across the street in a lot where the park is. Seems safe enough. Overall, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is newly renovated. The 2.5 star Priceline places on this hotel is underrated. The rooms are brand new. The staff are great, and you can't beat the location - literally minutes outside of downtown. And if you want to save yourself the $15 parking fee, just park across the street at the free city lot. It's safe and well-lit. We stayed with our 9 month old baby boy, and loved every minute of it!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our view”
Reviews.Author: FLR
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly the service was excellent. We had a nice view of the Space Needle. We had are own car so we did not need depend on hotel transportation. Our room was spacious and our King size bed was very comfortable. This Marriott is not on the beaten path but if you don't mind waiting for a shuttle or better yet if you have your own transportation, this Marriott is a great bet!

Reviews.Title: “Good but too far from downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: rhizome1844
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well kept, clean, but almost sterile. No real character. The rooms are spacious, and provide all you would need. Our view was a huge construction site but that did not disturb us. The main fault with this hotel is the location. The lake is beautiful but there was not much made of it - i.e. bars, rstaurants etc... (except Hooters!). The walk into downtown Seattle was not too far but was through busy roads, and unsavoury areas. The Shuttle was available - although we booked twice on it at the front desk but twice were told there was not enough room. It is visibly close to the Space Needle but again it is difficult to get to. The roads around this area are extremely busy and there are no really safe places to cross the roads (around the hotel). The location really spoilt our trip as there is lots to do in Seattle, but we spent a lot of time getting back to the hotel. Overall an average hotel that is extremely expencsive for what it is. The cleaners were exceptional but that it is it. Our bill was incorrect, (twice), and staff were rude when tackled about it. There were always lots of staff at the front desk - too many cooks??? Costs 35 dollars in a taxi from Sea-Tac and 30 (for two people) in a Shuttle Express.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - Construction site next door!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend in July 2005. Overall, this Courtyard is exactly what you would expect...decent service and clean comfortably appointed rooms. The beds were actually on the high end of the comfy scale. However (and to us it was a big one), there is a construction site across the street from the back side of the hotel. The rooms without a lake view look onto the site. The noise was pretty loud in our room on the back side. After discovering that the construction crew starts work at 7am on Saturday mornings, we requested to change rooms to the front side of the hotel. After some attitude from the staff who told us the noise was not the hotel's fault (duh), we were moved to a room on the side where the noise was still pretty bad on Monday morning. For $189 / night, I certainly expect better.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: elsie44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Courtyard at Lake Union for 3 nights in July, 2005. Great location! Walking distance to the Space Needle and other attractions. Close to several restaurants and across the street from Lake Union. Our room had a great view of the lake. The Courtyard has a wonderful FREE shuttle service to places like the Needle, Pike Place Market, the Convention Center, etc. We utilized this service every day. Parking just went up to $15/day but is still cheaper than downtown. Everyone at the Courtyard was very helpful and friendly. Very clean, well-kept property. The room (including the carpet) was spotless! Overall excellent value for Seattle area. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Awesome Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this property in June. Everthing was great. The staff in the restaurant was so kind and helpful with local activities to do. Food was great also. Hotel has a clean and new look. Must have had a recent renovation. Only thing that could have been better was the weather. But hey, it's Seattle!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: grad_girl_1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days over Memorial Day weekend, and thought the hotel was terrific in many ways: 1. They have a free shuttle to downtown areas, such as Pike's Market. It runs every 30 minutes, was always on time, and it was a great service. 2. Rooms were great...somebody in 2004 wrote a review saying the rooms were drab. This was not at all the case when we were there. I heard that the hotel was recently remodelled, so this might explain it. 3. The common areas of the hotel are very nice, too. Great equipment in the fitness room, a nice, roomy lobby with free apples and coffee in the morning, cookies in the afternoon. 4. Staff was responsive and friendly. 5. Free internet access in rooms. Overall, an excellent value. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Seattle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently had a wonderful stay at the Courtyard on Lake Union and was impressed with the convenient location and views of Lake Union and downtown Seattle. I used the free shuttle to go to the Seattle Center and the Experience Music Project and to Pike Place Market and it was very easy to get around town--they also stop at several other locations. Be sure to ask at the Front Desk for suggestion on where to visit--everyone was very friendly and make your reservations for the Shuttle--it runs 7-11 pm daily. The rooms have been recently upgraded ---everything was very clean and new--including the carpet! One of the best things about the Courtyard is the free Internet in the rooms, which is very easy to use--no complicated set up. The hotel has a great restaurant that looks out over Lake Union and is open for breakfast and dinner. The breakfast buffet is extensive and very good--you can even make your own waffles. You can have dinner in the restaurant and watch the lights on Lake Union or in the lounge next to the fireplace. The food quality and selection were very good, especially the Calamari and Salmon Caesar Salad. The restaurant and bar staff were very friendly and helpful with suggestions, the drinks were good and the atmosphere was cozy and comfortable. All in all a great place to stay with its convenient location and free Internet at a reasonable price. I plan to stay there again on my next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for 6 nights in January 2005. The hotel is undergoing refurbishment which did not disturb me at all during the stay. I was given a newly refurbished room, on the top floor, overlooking the lake. The room was very clean and had a big desk and chair, a storage chest as well as a wardrobe and also a sofa and coffee table. The bed was extremely comfortable (brand new) and I also appreciated the complimentary TV guide in the room (useful for when watching TV during the night - thanks to the jetlag!). The bathroom was small but again new and clean with a bath and shower attachment with good water pressure and a WC. The washbasin was actually outside the bathroom in a small vanity unit opposite the wardrobe (the dressing area as I referred to it!) and also had a coffee making machine. Room cleaning was thorough and items I sent to be laundered were returned promptly and neatly pressed. There is also a laundry room on the first floor of the hotel with wachine machine and tumble dryer facilities. The hotel has an adequate (if a little sweaty) gym on the 1st floor and also a swimming pool and jacuzzi on the ground floor. I found time to try out the gym but unfortunately not the pool! The hotel has a restaurant which is open for breakfast - a good buffet selection (hot food and waffles as well as a cold selection), and then serves room service/bar menu in the evenings. I ordered room service one night and the food was adequate although a little cold, and we had food in the bar one night which was fine although nothing special. The bar is dark but comfortable and has an adjoining sofa area next to a fire which is very nice. All staff I encountered were friendly and polite, especially Michael on reception who ensured that my colleague and I received the nicest rooms possible after our long journey. There is a small shop next to reception selling souvenirs, sweets, crisps, drinks, paper and books. Free coffee (starbucks) is also available with paper cups in reception every morning, and cookies in reception in the evenings (very soft, chewy and yummy!) The hotel also offers a free shuttle service to 5 locations in Seattle which is fantastic! Space Needle is a 20 minute walk away but I would recommend a taxi or the shuttle as it is not an easy walk and involves crossing madly busy highways!! The only downsides would be (in my opinion) the location in terms of what's around - there wasn't an obvious supermarket or store nearby and although there were a number of restaurants within walking distance they were on the whole more pricey - so a diner or deli would have been perfect - obviously this is not the fault of the hotel! The hotel is a pleasant 30 minute walk from Fremont which is a lovely quaint area full of nice shops and restaurants - I particularly recommend PCC wholefoods which has a fab selection of hot and cold foods as well as groceries and drinks, and baja fresh for fresh,, healthy mexican foods. For teas and coffees, Peet's would be my recommendation! I would certainly stay here again and would recommend this hotel as a mid-range hotel suitable for families or business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Bed was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: terrilee
Reviews.Content: The hotel was attractive and the staff was professional and friendly when I was there. The room was large and quiet. However, I found the bed surprisingly soft and had a sore back after my two day stay. Since I stay at hotels for a good night's sleep and not the frills, I found it disappointing.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott Seattle Downtown / Lake Union
HotelInfo.Address: 925 Westlake Ave. N, Seattle, WA 98109
